SHORT_DESCR.P: Framework agreement for application operation and further development of the transaction reporting system (NTRS) and commodity position reporting system CPRS, as well as possible additional professional systems connected to the securities sector.

MAIN_SITE.P: The Financial supervisory Authority of Norway´s premises, Revierstredet 3.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Financial supervisory Authority of Norway intends to enter into a framework agreement for application operation and testing/further development of the transaction reporting system and the reporting system for commodity derivates. The framework agreement can, in addition, include the development and operation of any new systems in the securities area, as well as consultancy and other accompanying services.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The framework agreement will be valid for 2 years, with an option for a further 1+1 year.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The procurement will also include an option for the development of any new systems within reporting in the securities area, if new rules make this necessary.

SUITABILITY.P: Requirement: Tenderers must be registered in a company register or a trade register in the country where the tenderer is established.
Foreign companies: Verification showing that the tenderer is registered in a company register or a commerce register in the country where the tenderer is established.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Requirement: Tenderers must have sufficient economic and financial capacity to fulfil the contract. Creditworthiness with no requirement for guarantees will be sufficient to meet the requirement.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Credit evaluation/rating, not older than three months, and which is based on the last known accounting figures. The rating shall be carried out by an officially certified credit rating institution.
The rating must be at least A or better, measured against the scale where AAA is highest, or an equivalent score from another reputable rating company.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: 1. Tenderers shall have experience from comparable contracts.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: 1. Description of the tenderer´s three most relevant assignments in the course of the last 3 years. The project description must include a specification of the project value, project length and state the Customer (name, phone and email.). The Contractor is responsible for documenting the projects’ relevance through their description. Tenderers can document experience by referring to competence in personnel who can be used in this contract, even if the experience that has been acquired while the personnel was in the service of another employer. The description must be maximum 2 pages per reference project.
At least one of the assignments must be from the public sector and at least one of the assignments must be within financing, preferably securities.

The references must show that the tenderer has experience with equivalent technology to that described in the qualification documentation and that the tenderer has knowledge of PKI and security systems.
Contact information must be provided for the customer, and the Financial supervisory Authority of Norway must be able to contact the references.
Tenderers must have a capacity, including sub-suppliers, of at least 6 consultants with relevant competence.
2. Tenderers must state the number of relevant resources. More than 15 resources with relevant competence will not give a higher score.
